author: undetermined
full_text:
7 Independent MPs to Support Narendra Modi-led NDA, Swearing-in Ceremony Likely on June 9

A day after Lok Sabha election results were declared, Prime Minister Narendra Modi tendered his resignation to President Droupadi Murmu, who accepted it and asked him to continue till the new government assumed office.

Key Updates:

1. Election Commission Voter Turnout:
- A voter turnout of 65.79 percent was recorded in the Lok Sabha elections
- Final figures may change as postal ballots are not included
- In 2019, voter turnout was 67.40 percent

2. Stock Market Controversy:
- Congress leader Rahul Gandhi alleged a "stock market scam" worth Rs 30 lakh crore
- Gandhi demanded a Joint Parliamentary Committee (JPC) probe
- BJP dismissed the allegations as baseless

3. Oath-Taking Ceremony:
- PM Modi's swearing-in ceremony is likely on June 9
- Top leaders from neighboring countries including Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, Maldives, Bhutan, Nepal, Mauritius, and Seychelles are expected to attend

4. Opposition Reactions:
- INDI bloc decided to "wait and watch"
- Congress leaders like Shashi Tharoor pledged to be a "robust and effective opposition"

5. International Reactions:
- Over 75 world leaders sent congratulatory messages to PM Modi
- US President Biden called Modi to congratulate him and discuss bilateral relations

The article highlights the post-election political developments and potential formation of the new government under Narendra Modi's leadership.
title: 7 Independent MPs to Support Narendra Modi-led NDA, Swearing-in Ceremony on June 9
vclaim: Prime Minister Modi resigned and was asked to continue until the new government takes office. The 2024 Lok Sabha elections recorded a 65.79% voter turnout, slightly lower than 2019's 67.40%. Rahul Gandhi alleged a Rs 30 lakh crore stock market scam and demanded a JPC probe. Prime Minister Modi's swearing-in ceremony is expected to take place on June 9 with leaders from neighboring countries attending. Over 75 world leaders congratulated PM Modi on his victory, including US President Biden who called to discuss bilateral relations.
